results.snippet: On June 13, Dava Sobel, a science reporter for The New York Times, entered the human chronophysiology laboratory of Montefiore Hospital, where she will remain until next Tuesday as a research subject. She is living in three rooms with boarded-up...
results.lead_paragraph: On June 13, Dava Sobel, a science reporter for The New York Times, entered the human chronophysiology laboratory of Montefiore Hospital, where she will remain until next Tuesday as a research subject. She is living in three rooms with boarded-up windows, cut off from the outside world, visited only by doctors and technicians who continually monitor her physical and emotional states. She sleeps, wakes and eats when she chooses, the rhythms of her own body replacing those set by the 24-hour day. The dates below show when each section of this dispatch was received. Miss Sobel begins this, the third of several reports she will file from the laboratory using a computer terminal, with an account of a dream. Thursday, June 26

headline.main: Advertising;  Campaign To Bolster The DC-10

results.snippet: HAVING attracted well over 20 reporters with the promise of ''a major announcement concerning the DC-10 jetliner,'' the McDonnell Douglas Corporation, its maker, delivered instead a report on its plans for a big international advertising image...
results.lead_paragraph: HAVING attracted well over 20 reporters with the promise of ''a major announcement concerning the DC-10 jetliner,'' the McDonnell Douglas Corporation, its maker, delivered instead a report on its plans for a big international advertising image campaign supporting the controversial aircraft. It will feature the corporation's own Charles Conrad Jr., lunar astronaut, as spokesman. The first question from the floor in the Imperial Ballroom of the Sheraton Center, following a long exposition of the ''vindicated'' aircraft and a showing of the advertising, came from Mike Eisgrau of WNEW News, who said: ''Tell me what the major announcement is here. It is a half-hour commercial. I don't see the point of all this.''

headline.main: U.N. WORLD CONFERENCE ON WOMEN OPENS TODAY IN COPENHAGEN

results.snippet: Midway into the United Nations Decade for Women, delegates from more than 100 countries are gathering here to evaluate what has been done to improve the lives of the world's women during the past five years and to plan for what should be done in the...
results.lead_paragraph: Midway into the United Nations Decade for Women, delegates from more than 100 countries are gathering here to evaluate what has been done to improve the lives of the world's women during the past five years and to plan for what should be done in the next five years. ''Copenhagen is Phase Two,'' one of the planners of the United Nations-sponsored world conference remarked today on the eve of its official opening. ''Those of us who are feminists see Copenhagen as the bureaucratization of the women's movement.''

results.abstract: UN World Conference on Women opens in Copenhagen; political clashes expected over Middle East because Palestine Liberation Organization and supporters have won 3-day agenda on issue; US delegation under Sarah Weddington to try to soften Palestinian stand; prominent delegates include Jihan el-Sadat, USSR astronaut Valentina Tereshkova and Arab hijacker Laila Khaled; illus; Denmark offered to host conference after Iran withdrew (M)

headline.main: Soviet Puts Spacecraft Aloft With 2 Aboard; One Is a Vietnamese; 'Cooperation Between Peoples'

results.snippet: MOSCOW, July 23 (AP) The Soviet Union launched a Soyuz spacecraft today with a 33-year-old Vietnamese Air Force pilot and a Soviet astronaut aboard, Tass, the official press agency, announced.
results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, July 23 (AP) The Soviet Union launched a Soyuz spacecraft today with a 33-year-old Vietnamese Air Force pilot and a Soviet astronaut aboard, Tass, the official press agency, announced.

headline.kicker: SOVIET PUTS SPACECRAFT ALOFT WITH 2 ABOARD

results.snippet: The Soviet Union launched a Soyuz spacecraft today with a 33-year-old Vietnamese Air Force pilot and a Soviet astronaut aboard, Tass, the official press agency, announced.         The launching at Baikonur comes while Moscow is in the spotlight as...
results.lead_paragraph: The Soviet Union launched a Soyuz spacecraft today with a 33-year-old Vietnamese Air Force pilot and a Soviet astronaut aboard, Tass, the official press agency, announced. The launching at Baikonur comes while Moscow is in the spotlight as host of the 1980 Olympics. Observers had expected a space ''spectacular'' to mark the occasion.

results.snippet: A Vietnamese astronaut, the first Asian in space, and his Soviet partner boarded the Salyut 6 space station today, joining two Russians who have been orbiting Earth for three and a half months, the Soviet press agency Tass said.         Viktor...
results.lead_paragraph: A Vietnamese astronaut, the first Asian in space, and his Soviet partner boarded the Salyut 6 space station today, joining two Russians who have been orbiting Earth for three and a half months, the Soviet press agency Tass said. Viktor Gorbatko, the flight commander, and Lieut. Col. Pham Tuan, a Vietnamese air force hero, were hurtled aloft aboard the Soyuz 37 shuttle craft yesterday from Soviet Central Asia.

headline.main: Asian and Russian Board Salyut 6; Shot Down First B-52 Space 'Spectacular' Expected

results.snippet: MOSCOW, July 24 (AP) A Vietnamese astronaut, the first Asian in space, and his Soviet partner boarded the Salyut 6 space station today, joining two Russians who have been orbiting Earth for three and a half months, the Soviet press agency Tass said.
results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, July 24 (AP) A Vietnamese astronaut, the first Asian in space, and his Soviet partner boarded the Salyut 6 space station today, joining two Russians who have been orbiting Earth for three and a half months, the Soviet press agency Tass said.

headline.main: MOSCOW ENJOYS GAMES IN SPITE OF ITSELF

results.snippet: The trolley bus pulled up at a stop and a middleaged woman with a threadbare  shopping bag got on. ''So, comrades,'' she addressed the world from her seat, ''the spies and diversionists have already begun.''         The others on the bus pretended...
results.lead_paragraph: The trolley bus pulled up at a stop and a middleaged woman with a threadbare shopping bag got on. ''So, comrades,'' she addressed the world from her seat, ''the spies and diversionists have already begun.'' The others on the bus pretended not to hear. From the cloth bags of the women and the bulging briefcases of the men, it was clear that their minds were on the hurried shopping for provisions done on their lunch breaks.

results.abstract: Most Muscovites appear to enjoy Olympic Games despite security precautions and warnings from Government officials that hostile agents might be among foreign tourists; illustration (M)
